article.headline: San Diego 63, Savannah St. 56
article.story: SAN DIEGO -- Roberto Mafra scored 14 points as San Diego used a balanced attack to hold off Savannah State 63-56 on Tuesday night. Mafra was one of four players in double figures for San Diego (6-8), which won for just the second time in nine games. De'Jon Jackson scored 13 points, and Matt Dorr and Chris Lewis had 12 each for the Toreros, who held a double-digit lead throughout most of the game. Arnold Louis scored a game-high 23 points to lead Savannah State (5-9) and Tracy Rankins finished with 15. The Toreros, who made their first six shots for a 14-4 lead, led 39-28 at halftime by hitting 65.0 percent from the field, including 5 of 7 3-pointers. A pair of 3-point shots by Matt Dorr gave San Diego its biggest lead of the game at 53-38 with 11:03 left. The Tigers battled back to within 62-56 on consecutive baskets by Louis in the last 39.8 seconds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
